content: Is there an easy way of downloading the data (or its subset) from perf.rlo into a SQLite file? It would be useful for filling local data when working on the perf.rlo site.
Not currently, no, there's some outdated archives though
there's a tool in the repo to download the old db
Michael Wigard has marked this topic as unresolved.

Unfortunately since the introduction of benchmark categories, the old file doesn't seem to work anymore without some minor fixing up... In any case I think it would be useful to have some recent data to test with...
You're right, after adding the category it's not very usable. It would be nice to add some API/endpoint for exporting some recent subset of data.
The main reason we haven't is that it currently takes a really long time to prepare the export; I haven't had the time to particularly optimize but I'm not sure that much improvement is possible.
even if e.g. only the last week worth of data was exported?

I think so, but not sure. Last week also is likely a pretty short window for some things (e.g. statistical analysis).

I have a to-do item to investigate export into Parquet via AWS functionality and then converting that to SQLite, but haven't had the time to look into it more.
I think that even just a week of data would be useful, just to test/develop locally with a lot of data
